text: Bomber. Not sure where I got this. Very dark with a tan head. A classic looking stout. First sip is big milk chocolate but there is also some char and alcohol heat. I do taste some of the marshmallows that are roasted on a stick over a campfire.
Black pour. Small tan head. Vanilla aroma with hints of chocolate. Smooth, creamy taste of the same.

22 oz bottle shared. Black appearance with a tan head. Aroma of graham crackers, marshmallows, chocolate malt and light vanilla. Similar flavor, adding caramel/toffee, medium to heavy sweetness and minimal bitterness. Smooth, creamy feel with a sweet finish. Nice.  (Note: This bottled was aged a few years)
22 oz bottle. Black in color with a decent tan head. Aroma is of graham cracker, honey, cocoa, chocolate, and vanilla. Taste is of vanilla, chocolate, Teddy Grahams, toast and toffee.
Bottle. The look is black in color, tan head, dark. The smell is smokey, smores, graham cracker, sweet like, interesting. The taste is much the same, chalky, smoke, and good.
Slight smoke as in burnt, but not smoked like meat. Cocoa, vanilla and bread graham are all there, but light. Mouth is medium. Bottle.

On tap at Lanesplitter Pizza and Pub, Pours a black color with khaki head. Roasted malt, chocolate, graham cracker, licorice, marshmallow, molasses and some vanilla. Really enjoyed this stout. Would recommend to friends!

This bottled brew from a bottle shop was served at a cool temperature and poured a small sized head of foamy finely sized light brown colored bubbles that were mostly diminishing and left behind a typically carbonated body opaque black brown colored body and a very good lacing. The mild aroma was dark malt. The mouth feel was weakly tingly at the start and at the finish roasted malt aftertaste. The nice flavor contained notes of roasted malt mild hops brown malt and dark malt. A decent one that I would consider drinking again.

Black pour with a ruby hue and a thin beige head .... aroma of cocoa, chocolate, marshmallow and graham cracker along with molasses and roasted malts ..... taste is of marshmallow, cocoa, chocolate, molasses, roasted malts and light graham cracker/spices ..... definitely the best "smores" style beer Ive had .... spiced on the back end and info the finish which has roasted malts and cocoa as well .... has some bitterness on the backend .... nice dessert stout
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Fantastyczne kakao i pijalność, znakomity FES.

Bomber from Wegmans. Pours turbid black with frothy tan head. Nose is delicious chocolate and graham crackers, vanilla, marshmallows. Tastes like a liquid Smore, with the sweet marshmallow up front, and the choc and graham cracker right after. What I like about this beer is that the brewers obviously tasted it at every stage, and even before bottling, and they succeeded in what their goal was here. This is a solid beer, like a Smore in a glass, and purists who would denigrate it on technicalities can suck deez nutz.

650 ml. bottled 12/16/2015. Pours ebony with a thin smattering of cream on top. Nose is semi-sweet chocolate, coffee with cream and graham cracker. Tastes of milk chocolate, vanilla, graham cracker and a touch of coffee. Near-medium bodied with medium-plus carbonation.

I loved the smores character ruminating from this super delicious brew. Not sure how they did it but they got marshmallow and graham cracker dialed in with the chocolate to taste incredibly like smores married to a stout.

Growler Guys, Seattle. On nitro, but am assured it is the 6.5% version. Off white soft foam, dark black. Lovely sweet marshmallow and light roast aroma. Smooth sweet body, light bitter roast. Molten smores. Has a lot of the character, dry graham cracker and milk chocolate. Intriguing winter sweet stout. Not really my thing but I really appreciate it.

Tap at Erzbierschof Zurich. Pours very dark brown with decent short lived head. Aroma reminds of a boozy intense dark chocolate cake, a Schwarzwäldertorte. Some vanilla, lots of chocolate, but also a bit of the campfire, cherry. Body is medium and a tad sour. Together with the lively carbonation, that makes the beer refreshing, but it also quite surprising, to the point where Im not so fond of that sudden change. Palate is fair, cherry, but rather short. Oh man, if this aroma carried throughout the beer, this would be a killer...

Draft sampled at GABF 2016 with Paul and Larry. Pours a deep black body with thin lacing. Nose is sweet sugar. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with notes of sweet, melted marshmallows, sugar and chocolate. Nice sweet stout.

2015 BJCP Category: 30A Spice/Herb/Vegetable (base style: 20B American Stout)
AROMA: Candybar-like milk chocolate is prominent. Sweet dark malt with light roast. Faint cinnamon. 8/12APPEARANCE: Inky opaque black body. Small, tan foam fizzles away quickly. No lacing. 1/3FLAVOR: This stout is brewed with graham crackers, molasses and "natural flavors," though the strongest flavor is vanilla (milk chocolate). I do not get cinnamon or marshmallow (theyve probably faded). Quite sweet throughout, but not cloying. Faint taste of roasted malt on the finish. Low bitterness with trace of piney hops. Tasty, but simple and repetitive. 14/20MOUTHFEEL: Medium-light body; fairly low CO2. Texture is soft and smooth with no alcohol presence. Slight milky aftertaste, otherwise clean. 3/5OVERALL IMPRESSION: A novel idea for a brew thats tasty without becoming cloying. A little smoked malt would enhance the "campfire" theme. Probably more robust and complex when fresh. 7/10TOTAL SCORE: 33/50NOTE: I am a rank-pending BJCP judge. I am reviewing commercial beer to BJCP specs to hone my judging skills.

Pours a dark brown almost black color with khaki colored head. Roasted malt, chocolate, graham cracker, marshmallow sweetness, and some vanilla on the nose; follows onto the palate. Medium to full bodied. Finishes with chocolatey sweetness.

22 oz bottle. Pours a very dark brown almost black in color with a smooth layer of tan colored foam at the head that shows good retention and slowly settles to a thin film. Some sudsy lacing are left behind in a wash. The aroma shows notes of dark chocolate, graham cracker, caramel, toasted vanilla and marshmallow. The flavor follows suit with the dark chocolate, caramel and toasted vanilla up front to go with notes of graham cracker and some earth roast to add some balancing bitterness. Medium bodied and smooth with subtle carbonation leading to a dry, sweet, and toasted vanilla finish. Nice easy drinking stout that reminds you of a smore, which is definitely a childhood favorite.
Creamy and complex and good but I did not find it stood out enough in any way to be great. I had to guess at the marshmallow notes, yeah the cracker and chocolate are there. On tap at the Playhouse.

Bottle a black colored beer with a white head aroma roasted malts coffee chocolate dark fruits caramel spicy and hops flavor roasted malts coffee mocha chocolate dark fruits caramel some oak and a bitter hoppy aftertaste

750ml bottle shared at the New Glarus R & D Release #1 (New Glarus, WI). Pours a darker brownish black hue, a more opaque body with some brownish carmelized glow on the edges and bottom. Tannish frothy head atop is a firm layer, nice enough lacing dies down to a filmy layer, mellow lacing throughout is foamy like hot chocolate. Aromas are a bit toasty, roasty, subtle vanilla and marshmellow meet caramel, biscuit, graham cracker, and cocoa. Initial is medium bodied, not as thick as youd expect with some richer caramel, graham, and cocoa nibs. Vanilla and marshmellow appeal into the backend is a bit sweet and soft, some roasty appeal grows. Brown malt, earthy, chocolate remnants. Not as rich flavors as youd expect but lighter, an easier drinker. Nice.

Dark brown pour with beige head. Aroma of chocolate, caramel, vanilla, roasted malts and hops. Taste of chocolate, roasted malts, caramel, graham crackers and hops. Medium bodied, medium carbonation, nicely balanced. Good solid stout.

Keg at Cafe Beermoth, Manchester. Black with lasting brown head. Vivid marshmallow aroma. Thick, robust, powerful taste with chocolatey notes. Well balanced taste but I would prefer a bit more sweetness personally. Very good overall.
On tap at Black Rider Zurich. Dark black body with tall head. Nose of chocoate, malts, vanilla, sweet. Taste is sweet also with caramel, chocolate and plums. Well done.

Nice mild graham cracker aroma. Nothing in this beer is overpowering, which makes the unique s'more flavour they're going for much nicer. Good stout with a twist.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft. Pours near black with a dark tan head. Yep, tastes like smores. Graham crackers, chocolate, and lighter marshmallow. Like many sweet gimmick beers, this is great in a small pour.
Creamy, rustic, and chocolatey. Beautiful dark color in the glass. Smooth finish.

On Tap @ Bay Area Craft Beer Festival, Martinez, California (16.04.2016) 

Czarny kolor, średnia beżowa piana. W aromacie i smaku MEGA czekolada! Poza tym melasa i kawa z mlekiem.
Największą jednak niespodzianką jest aromat i smak słynnych amerykańskich pianek Marshmallow opiekanych na ognisku. Słodkie, delikatne, gładkie, kremowe.
Absolutnie genialne!

650 ml bottle. Pours black with full head. Aromas of milk chocolate, vanilla, and marshmallow - as advertised. Flavors of same with additional sweet malts and graham cracker. Like a sweet mocha. Lighter than expected. A fun stout.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2016 22oz bottle, served in snifter glass. Poured black with a two finger tan head. Low on carbonation. Delicious aromas of roasted nuts, marshmallow, milk chocolate, vanilla and crackers. Taste: Whoah! Like having a big bite out of a milk chocolate hazelnut bar with marshmallow and letting it melt in your mouth. Vanilla is also very dominant in the flavor. Further notes of molasses, licorice, caramelized creme brulee, coffee, crackers, whole wheat bread, roasted nuts, butterscotch, leather, currants. This is delicious, its one of the best of its kind. Such a thick, gloopy and sticky mouthfeel. A medium to full body with a roasted sweet finish of molasses and marshmallow chocolate. Absolutely divine stout, one of the best I have tasted...
22 oz bottle pours black with a tan head. Aroma of vanilla, chocolate, graham crackers and grains. Taste is chocolate, vanilla and marshmallows.

Bottle, black beer, decent almond colored head. Aroma chocolate, vanilla, cream soda, toasted barley. Taste cream soda, vanilla, toasted barley, chocolate, hint of dried plums and cherries, touch of metal . Palate is nice, carb moderate. Finish is dry.
On tap at hopaholic. Black colour, medium brown head. Nose is candy floss, with slight cocoa. Taste is low, longlasting bitterness, some cocoa, coffee. Slightly watery mouthfeel. Nice stout.

dark brown colour, huge, dense brown head; aroma of Frappé with chocolate, vanilla and wallnut notes; taste is the same a bit less intensity; amazing stout - definitely the best one, Ive ever tasted!

On tap at blackbird. Red bean paste on the nose. Medium bodied, soft roast, vanilla, chocolate, very vague hint of smoke. Slo chocolate, a little bit of smoke into the finish. Sweetness lingers from the red bean flavors.

Black body, small brown head. Aroma of cocoa, momasse, marshmallow, vanilla, coffee notes. Flavours of cocoa, marshmallow, molasse, vanilla, light roasted malt notes. Long cocoa and molasse bitter finish. Ends up dry. Medium-full body, medium-small carbo. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Strong, sweet taste with plenty of chocolate and some roastiness. Looks just ok.
In terms of sweet stouts this one is top tier. Everything promised is delivered on. So good.

fra fad duft: chokoalde ristet malt en del sødme
smag: sød kara ristet malt chokolade lidt funkey nærmest kemi sukker smag. ristet blid mørkt malt

Extremely good and delicious intro to High Water. They probably had to cheat in the flavor department, but it is worth it. Every malty peak is right where you would want it. Excellent dessert-style beer. 22oz bottle
Pitch black pour, smaller head. Very sweet with chocolate and vanilla prominent in aroma and taste. Get more marshmallow in the taste. Dessert beer, but a bit cloying
Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Blackish pour with a frothy tan head. Notes of vanilla, caramel, cocoa, milk chocolate, sweet sticky, grains and some crackers. Good indeed!
A sweet stout, in fact way too sweet. Serves some people I suppose. Opaque black. From Premier.

Sample c4. Pours nearly black with a brown head. Aroma of cocoa powder, vanilla, very sweet, marshmallows, biscuit, cant sense the roast. Taste is very sweet, marshmallows, wiped cream. Very sweet. Nice

My Bottom Line:
Vanilla, lactose and milk chocolate swim around in this silky take on a Milk Stout.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A slice of foam covers the darkness.
-The nose is a surefire replica of marshmallows and melting milk chocolate.
-The mouthfeel is rich yet easygoing.
-The flavor profile is leaning too heavily on the vanilla and lactose, imho.
-This would be a dessert lovers delight on nitro.
-Cereals (and graham crackers) could be more apparent in the flavor profile.

Bottle.

(Tap at Fairbar)
Black body with a brown head.
Aroma and flavour are caramel malt and sweet rum, with spicy notes. Medium sweetness and bitterness. Rich and intense.
Full body with average carbonation.

A very delicious stout. Tastes like a beer with a much higher abv.

Dark brown color, almost black with brown head. Aroma has a lactic / vanilla sweetness, biscuits, chocolate and a bit of roast / smoke. Taste is more roasty and bitter, not what I expected from the aroma. Just a bit of chocolate and vanilla in the background. Body is medium to heavy with low carbonation. Quite nice overall, really easy to drink. I expected "smore" on the taste though.
Tap. Totally black with a tan head. Strong cocoa and sirup aroma, very slightly smokey. Very nice and easy to drink.

Great beer overall that definitely is campfire reminiscent. Dark in color and easily finds the graham cracker and marshmallow flavors. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Black with a tan head. vanilla, chocolate, roasted malts, marshmallow, toasted malts, light cookie dough. Full bodied. Sweet, light vanilla and toasted finish. Very enjoyable.

The aroma has lots of graham cracker, marshmallow, milk chocolate, smooth roast and vanilla. Wonderful aroma. The taste is drier with milk chocolate, crackers, spices and woodiness. The finish has more cocoa. Really nice.

Draft pour pint at Frankies Pizza. Pours black with a tan foam head. Chocolate, sugar cookie like aroma. Flavor is marshmallow, chocolate, and cookie. So I guess it is like a smore, though I cant recall ever having a smore in my lifetime so I guess I cant be sure. I can be sure though that the beer is both good, and unique. Mild roasted and vanilla finish. Very nice.

i drank this the normal way ... dark brown .. i saw foam .. . smore like for sure, mild brown malt and dark cookie .. mouth is mild, as is the finish . nothing really stands out but a quaffable stout .. . . bong hits of salvia are fun, right nate?

Smells very nice like sweet vanilla biscuits, chocolate milk and a little bit liquorice. Pours very dark brown almost black with light brown head. The palate is a bit dissapointing as it should be much thicker.

bottle poured into a snifter..dark with a fluffy tan head..aroma of chocolate,
roasted nuts,molasses,vanilla,marshmallow..tastes like it smells..not overly
sweet..good stuff.
Dessert in a glass without the diabetes. I can drink this a lot. Mild sweetness but bigger aroma and chocolate that suggested.
UPDATED: OCT 28, 2015 Smell is mild roast and vaguely smore. Taste is mostly roast and minerals with mild marshmallow and faint graham cracker. Medium body, medium carbonation, and no foam.

Poured from the bomber while deer hunting. Aroma is a smore. Flavor is a smore. Flavor is a smore.. Palate is a smore, hahaha. Seriously, this thing is smokey, sweet, chocolate, honey, yup, overall its a smore.

Tap @ Fermentoren. Pours a very dark brown towards black with a brown head. Aroma of marshmallows, sweet buttery biscuit, milk chocolate, vanilla, toffee and sweet hazelnuts. The taste is sweet and mellow with some weak bitter cocoa notes. also some marshmallows, biscuits, nuts and a smooth bitter end with a slight amount of roast.

Tallahassee, Fl - Beer Stop - 22 oz bomber. Deep dark, motor oil like black pour, thick khaki colored head, thin veil of lacing, Aroma has some roasted espresso notes. Chocolate, creosote and espresso in the aroma. Full-bodied flavor with tons of chocolaty goodness, some roasted notes, a touch of espresso, a hint of vanilla and some biscotti. Rich, thick mouthfeel. Much better than expected.

650ml bottle. Dark brown almost black color with beige brown head. Roasted malty aroma, coffee, chocolate, caramel, some vanilla. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.
Bottle from BevMo! in Redwood City, CA. Strong aroma of vanilla, malt, chocolate. Taste is sweet and big up front...ends quickly. Was hoping for some smokiness but ultimately still really loved this.
Draft @ Beertemple. Black with a tan head. Aroma of chocolate and marshmellow. Taste is sweet, chocolate, bit watery, but nice.

This was poured into a nonic pint glass. 
The appearance was a dark brown close to black color with an off white to tan foamy head that dissipated fairly quickly. Stringy lacing starts and slides into the beer.
The smell starts off with rich sweet milk chocolate with a light graham cracker lightening the sweetness. As it warmed, marshmallow does come out nicely. Some coffee notes do round it all out.
The taste was moderately sweet with the balance between the graham cracker maintaining a sweet to super light bitter coffee aftertaste. Theres a sweet sticky finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a nice sessionability about it. Carbonation runs extremely light, almost drinks like coffee its so smooth.
Overall, I liked it for me, but that mouthfeeel, holy sticky sweetness, they probably could have beefed up the carbonation on this one and everything would have been okay.

Nice aroma, sweet grapes, some vanilla and toasty cookies. Pours bubbly black with little head that fades quickly. Taste is smooth vanilla with some roasty bitterness. A bit one note and lacking depth. Sweet with a quick finish.

Nice thick creamy tan head. Aroma is intense. Lots of brown sugar and cocoa. Chewy mouthfeel. Lots of bittersweet chocolate, with a decent bitterness on the back end. A wonderful sipping beer. Sort of brings on visions of sitting in front of a warm fire in a snowbound cabin in the Sierras.
draft at Moor Pat, Williamsvile, NY. creamy mouthfeel, dark pour, chocolate heavy, smores?? i suppose so, either way nice flavorful sweet stout

Draft pour at Churchills. Poured a pitch black color with a small tan head. Aroma was light smores, graham cracker is most apparent. Light chocolate with a little bit of graham cracker is there in the flavor with a little campfire smoke in there to boot. Pretty tasty!
Glass at beertemple amsterdam, Black beer, small head, aroma is coffee, roasted, chocolate. Taste is the same, somewhat sweet and bitter.
Bottle. Almost black with good creamy foam. Aroma: vanilla and very sweet chocolate. Taste: chocolate, cream, cappuccino with chocolate and brandy, vanilla.
Smells and tastes just like smores in a bottle..very tasty...hands down the best of its kind!

Draught. Pitch black with beige head. Aromas of dark chocolate, coffee, butterscotch. In taste sweet, roasty with dark chocolate flavour. Medium body, smooth on the palate and finished with medium herbal bitterness. Solid stout.

In terms of sweet stouts this one is top tier. Everything promised is delivered on. So good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. A sweet beer. Roasted malt of coirse. Sugar, sweet potato, and marshmellow. No smoke, which i was hoping for based on the name.

Bottle shared by Jeff at Shakespears. Pours coca cola brown with a beige head. Aroma is snores over a campfire, impressive! Taste falls a bit short of the aroma, caramel, chocolate, vanilla. A bit of char in the finish.
Bottle, 650 ml at Svijet Piva, Zagreb. Shared with Marko and others. Pours black with light brown head. Chocolate aroma. Caramel, chocolate bit fruity and lactose. Good one.
Amazing Graham cracker arome. Very dry chocolatey mouthfeel, slight marshmallow. Not amazing but nicely subdued

Negro con espuma beis opaca. aromas de cereal dulce, cacao, chocolate y frutso rojos. Cuerpo medio, maltoso, con inicio de cereal dulce, fruto negro y sabor de chocolate que conduce un final de amargor equilibrado y tostado.

Very dark brown, almost completely black, average sized brown head. Aroma of vanilla, chocolate, coffee, cake, some fruitiness. Taste of coffee, chocolate, fruitiness, slightly smokey, cake. Medium body, soft carbonation. Excellent stuff.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Clear black color, small tan/brown head. Aroma is chocolate cake with hints of cocoa and milk chocolate. Taste is lots and lots of chocolate and vanilla, some smokiness. Oily texture, flat carbonation, medium body. Nicely balanced with nice and long chocolate finish. Pretty nice. //pivoteka

66cl bottle, served in tulip. Deep dark brown colour with beige frothy head. Both aroma and taste are mostly roasted malts and chocolate, the flavour has some extra cereal notes...and a subtle hoppy touch. It is so well proportioned in every aspect, really pleasant on the palate. Best "Stout" Ive ever tried until date, and I highly doubt to find something equal for that price. Magnificent!
Bottle. Pours a dark brown with small beige head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is marshmallow and chocolate. Medium mouth, similar flavors to nose, very sweet, cracker malt, really good.

Bottle, bought at Svijet piva, Zagreb. Very dark liquid with tan head. Full body, light carbonation. Strong vanilla extract aroma and taste. Some roastiness and sourness. Stronger vanilla extract bitterness. Nice.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Draft @ beer temple. Blackish pour, white brown head. Aroma of liquid chocolate and creamy milk. Taste is very creamy and milky, with soft milk chocolate, marshmallow and a mild coffee-ish bitter in the finish. This is liquid desert, like the Dutch desert Hopjesvla. Fantastic beer.

on tap at Fermentoren aarhus. appear black with a fine head. soft marshmallow aroma, with chocolate and coffe hints. taste medium sweet, very light bitter. smooth mouthfeel, with a soft carbonation.

please make more marshmallow stouts.

From SPD In Nevada City CA Pours black with a big tan head. Light lacing. Nose of chocolate. More chocolate. Body and a smooooooth mouth feel. Big llavor of chocolate and some citrus hops and a chocolate finish. Really tasty. Did I mention the chocolate?

Draught at the Stateline Brewery, South Lake Tahoe, CA.
Black colour with a small tan head. 
The aroma is chocolate... chocolate and chocolate sweetness. Maybe mild malt there too. The flavour is chocolate liqueur. Some roasted malt and mild bitter hops there too but the chocolate liqueur is very dominating. Rich.

Thanks Vanja, Iznogud & Co.! Almost black body, dark head. Nothing too remarkable, typically nice. Ive heard nothing but superlatives about this one from those in the Croatian crew whove tried it, but even that didnt prepare me for the sublime, wonderful, beautiful cocoa/milk chocolate aroma that wafted from the glass... The same thankfully continued into the taste, only buried in layers of caramel. Not much hops, but this didnt need hops. Wow, wow wow wow! Beer of the day and the competition was awesome!Note: City of origin was apparently San José so this batch was brewed at Hermitage I guess.
Black with a brown head - Malt aroma with some choclate - Good malt body with roasted malt and some chocolate flavours - Good long malt finish with chocolate and hints of vanilla - This was good
22 ounce bottle. Pours dark brown with a decent tan head. Aroma of malt, chocolate, and vanilla. Taste is milk chocolate, roasted malt, vanilla, coffee, and spice. Want smore!
On tap at Biercab. Black colour with tan head. Roasted and marshmallow aroma. Sweet, marshmallow,roasted, slightly acidic taste. Medium body.
Bottle. Pours a near-black color with a tan head on there. Nose is roasty with a sone sweetness. marshmellows? Taste is light and sweet. Mouthfeel is thin OK not great.
Botella. @Cimmeria, Oviedo 28/03/2015. Color negro, espuma blanca. Aroma a chocolate, sabor dulce, Carboantacion baja..
this is like drinking an alcohol laced shmore. This is a great dessert beer. Only purchased this due to a recommendation from a guy from Bevmo.

Draft at Barrel Republic. Pours dark brown with a very thin head. Tastes like coffee, dry toasted malt, vanilla, marshmallow, bitter chocolate. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like a sweet smores flavored candy.

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2015 Looks like coke in a glass. Smells of treacle vanilla and prunes. Taste corresponds with the smell with the addition of a coffee taste. Slightly sweet, but has a light fizz that cuts through the sweetness. Nice stout. (K) (Re-rated N)

Pours a deep brown color with a chocolate and marshmellow aroma. Taste is similar, chocolate, marshmellow, with a hint of graham cracker in the flavor. A smooth flavorful stout that was complex and easy drinking.

Very heavy vanilla/marshmallow with long finish.
A bit of smoke.
....................................

On tap. Pours black color, small head. Aroma is way too much caramel. It just smells like Im sniffing a Werthers original. Just overpowering. Flavor is roasted, tons and tons of caramel. Just too much. Watery mouthfeel. Not a good Stout.

Bottle from Beermoth, Manchester. Black pour with a tan head. Nice aromas of licorice, chocolate wafer and rich, dark coffee roast. Flavours of chocolate ice cream, caramel, toffee, black treacle and vanilla fudge Quite a robust brew. Long, sweet malt linger. Andsome!
UPDATED: JUN 15, 2015 Bomber. Aroma of spent coffee grounds. Flavors of coffee, giving way to chocolate with a bit of toast on the finish. Really nice, especially at 6.5%.

Almost black, a head is medium and beige. The nose has chocolate, some liquirice, sweetness of vanilla, hint of peppermint. Great aroma. Taste has liquirice, some chocolate and peppermint, mild bitterness, some roastiness in the end. Medium+ bodied, smooth and pleasant to drink. Enjoyable, smooth and quite sweet stout but still the balance is great. Very good.
Tap @ Taphouse, Copenhagen 23/1-15. Chocolatey (milk chocolate), vanilla. Body is medium, the finish is chocolatey.
Tap @ Taphouse, Copenhagen 150123. Roasted malty with lots of chocolate and vanilla, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry and roasted with chocolate.

On tap 5 oz. taster at Churchill's Pub & Grill in San Marcos, CA. 

Opaque, brown-black with a tan head and very good lacing. 

Aroma of chocolate milk, vanilla and caramel. 

Taste of milk chocolate, roasted malt, coffee, cream, vanilla, and graham cracker spiciness. 

Medium/full body and medium carbonation. 

Recreates s'more taste in liquid form, on a roasted malt base.



---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From the tap. Dark with a brown foamy head on the rim. Chocolate aroma with a bitter roast malt. Strong chocolate flavor with spicy notes and ginger with a lingering sweetness. Light-medium body with a bite on tongue.

Bottle... Pours mostly clear and dark brown with a small, creamy, beige head. Smells like all the things that make smores great  milk chocolate, marshmallows and graham. Medium-bodied with a lightly creamy mouthfeel and tingly carbonation. Bittersweet with loads of vanilla, dark-roast coffee and mild carbonic bitterness in both the flavor and finish. Bottle courtesy of newcigarz!
Very good. Chocolate, marshmallows, vanilla. Taste is very sweet, some happiness would have made it perfect for me

On tap at Maggies Pub in Ferndale, pours black with a small tan head. Nose brings out loads of smores with intense sweetness. Flavour is incredibly sweet, with loads of caramel and chocolate. Way too sweet for me, but its a nice novelty dessert beer.
Black body with a generous dark brown head. The nose and flavor gives you everything you would think it should. The description pretty much sums it up. Good stuff.
Intense coffe-chocolate aroma and taste. Thin white head. Better warm than cold. Good stout.

Pours a dark black pour with a Java head. Nose is graham crackers and marshmallow and sweet. Taste is chocolate , sweet marshmallow, and graham crackers, a real liquid smore. Finishes sweetly and ends on the same tasting notes. A very unique and quite different stout. QuaffScore 8 / 10

Bomber. Pours pitch black with a brown head and nice sweet chocolate, vanilla aroma. Taste is delicious, lots of creamy milk chocolate with vanilla, Marshmellow, and caramel notes leading to a sweet chocolate filled finish. Very flavorful stout

Bottle. Pours light brown, beige head. Big marshmellow and bakers chocolate aroma. Flavor has surprising graham cracker, cashew, marshmellow sweetness, complemented by smoke and chocolate. Finishes of medium length, light carbonation. Excellent execution.
Bottle at Appellation. Pours black, nose is marshmallow, chocolate milkshake, coffee, taste is similar, dry roasted.

Bottle at tasting. Pours black with a thin tan head. Nose is chocolate milkshake, caramel. Rolos, as Ash said. Taste brings a touch of smoke, loads more chocolate. Not as set a finish as I thought, and good body for the strength. Very nice.

Bottle at the Appellation Comely Bank tasting. Thanks to Stuu666 I think.
Appearance - close to opaque black with a lovely fawn head. 
Nose - intensely creamy milk chocolate. Theres a tiny smoky backdrop if you look for it.
Taste - yes milk chocolate again. Some caramel. This is reminding me of Rolos which I havent had in years. Again, a tiny smoke note.
Palate - medium to full bodied with a gorgeous creamy texture and a balanced finish, where the touch smoke helps to take away any over sweetness there might be.
Overall - really lovely beer.
Bottle. Black with tan head. Lots of dark chocolate, roasty, some molasses. Taste has lots chocolate, some roast. Medium body. Nice

Dark brown with listless tanny head. Thick rice krispie cake nose, chunky marshmallow. Lean choco Milk Initial taste, spicy sweetness and lean roast. Finishes faintly sweet but tinny cough drop marshmallow.

Loved this beer. It's like a liquid dessert. Carol loved it too. This is a rest dessert beer to end the evening. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Botella de 65 cl en el lúpulo en enero de 2014 stout suave y fácil de beber con un cuerpo medio de 6.5 vol y un gran sabor a cacao y algo de especias. Bastante buena, para repetir.
UPDATED: NOV 30, 2014 (tap) clear very dark brown colour with a small brown head; aroma of chocolate, vanilla; slightly creamy palate; rich, balanced flavour with a long light bitter finish
A solid stout. Black pour from 22oz bottle at home. Tan head. Chocolate and cocoa flavor, milky, rich and silky on the pallette. Very good.

(bottle - 22 oz) Dark brown pour with a thick and puffy tan head. Heavy roasted aroma with tons of cocoa and a light graham cracker note. Flavor is cocoa, chocolate, light smoke, graham cracker and a mild hint of marshmallow at the end. Definitely tastes like drinking a smore.

Bottle. My first from this brewery. Black with a medium head that was slow to dissipate but the wait was worth it.. Chocolate dominates with coffee also floating around. A bit predictable but still very drinkable.

22 oz bottle thanks to Wittales. Pours deep dark brown with ample frothy khaki head. Good lacing. Aroma: cola, vanilla cream soda, toasted marshmallows. Taste: Cherry cola syrup. Copper. Light roast/ash. I could see this as a sorta wonky smore. Palate: medium body, slick texture, average carbonation. Overall: Id like a little more campfire.

Black with an off-white head. Aroma is s'mores, caramel, chocolate, burnt sugar, vanilla. Medium bodied, sweet on the palate with a slightly bittersweet finish. Taste is graham cracker, chocolate, vanilla, burnt sugar.

Aroma - chocolate!!!! Chocolate milk, chocolate sauce, chocolate. 
Appearance - black as night. Small head. 
Taste - amazingly smooth milky chocolate stout with very little grainy character. 
Palate - a little carbonation bite in the middle of my tongue, dissipates quickly into a smooth finish. 
Overall - really great desert beer. Decadent.

Tap at World Craft Beer Tasting 2014. Aromas of cocoa, heavier chocolate, marshmallow, Dark brown. Mild chocolate, thick raost malt, more chocolate, and it fades slowly. Thin-medium body, a bit too thin in mid and final. Nose is very sweet. Not quite off-putting, but nearly. Flavors are not as strong. Tasty for what it is. But hard to finish one glass.

Tap at World Craft Beer Tasting 2014. Huge cocoa and graham cracker nose. Before knowing what it was, I said, "Smells like smores." I guess that means they nailed it. More cocoa and chocolate. Sweet cocoa, marshmallow, graham crackers. A bit too thin when you consider the flavor. Cant drink a lot, but I like it.

UPDATED: OCT 12, 2015 Tap at Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours pitch Black with a dense, fluffy, light Brown head. Aroma has chocolate and caramel malts, sugary sweetness, vanilla, milk chocolate and a Nice little roast. Taste is packed with candy. Marshmallows, chocolate, vanilla, caramel and so on. Sweet, but not over the top. Only thing to put on this, is that it could carry more alcohol. The alcohol there is, is really really well hidden. Pretty full body and a mild carbonation. One of the better non-imperial stouts ive had for sure!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 5, 2015 Tap. Pours black with a brown/ruby edge and tan creamy but small head. Aroma is sweet milk chocolate, and a lot of it! Vanilla, marshmallow, some subtle coffee. Taste is sweet with same notes as aroma and a bit roast. Really soft and smooth. Finish has a pleasant light dryness. Great interpretation that doesnt get too sweet. Calling for a scoop of vanilla ice cream.

Bottle. Pours a pitch black with a robust, but short lived tan head which produces minimal lacing. Both the taste and the aroma and are slightly sweet overall. Vanilla, chocolate, toasted malts with hints of gram crackers. . Medium-full body and medium carbonation. Round mouthfeel. Overall, this is an extremely tasty and well crafted stout.

Draft at OB Noodle House. Classic stout pour with a thin tan head. Really cool aroma that is reminiscent of a roasted marshmallow. The flavor starts sweet and finishes with espresso and dark chocolate. Very nice.
Bottle @ Haket Bar. Dark brown with a tiny brown head. Malty and chocolate tones. Malt, chocolate, coffee and hops. Medium body with a nice balanced finish.

I was expecting smoke (and theres a hint, but just a hint) but I got smores instead. Cool surprise for this guy, who apparently needs to read the label and not assume campfire means smoke. Pretty fizzy for the style, otherwise very solid desert like stout.

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2015 Tap at Craft Beer Co. Clerkenwell. Pours black with a frothy brown cream head. This beer looks amazing! Aromas of vanilla, fudge, marshmellows, mocca. Taste is very smooth. Lots of marshmellow, vanilla and cookie. Missing some roast and feel though.

650ml bottle. Forgot where i got this, sorry for the lack of credits if it came in a trade. Pours a blackish-brownish with a medium beige head that has fair retention. The aroma is very chocolaty with multi-layered cocoa, mocha and just a trace of smoke. The taste, like the aroma, features chocolate, mocha, vanilla and cocoa. Any smoke in here is well hidden and well obscured. The palate is full and smooth with soft carbonation. Finishes long and dry with lingering cocoa. Decent cocoa beer, very chocolaty, but I was expecting smoke.

on tap at Erzbierschof Winterthur. deep black, with a nice large head - beautiful. Smells like chocolate milk, tastes like chocolate milk, with more coffee and bitterness towards the end - great stout!

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2017 This beer is like a bonbon melting on your tongue! Tastes predominantly like chocolate and mocha, with some bitterness added in. For the Dutch people: this beer tastes just like Haagse Hopjes. Great stout, would recommend this.

THANKS! 15 cl. draft @ Delrium Hoppy Loft. Black with mocha head. Smells like sweet Eastern-European chocolate, instant chocolate milk and chocolate syrup. Taste is the same with cacao and vanilla plus some Eastern-European milk chocolate. Very nice, I do wish that this was a bit more Belgian chocolate tan Eastern-European as far as taste goes but still very nice, chocolate rich beer.

Bottled 650ml. -from Hoppiness Koper. Pitch black coloured, medium sized brown head, milk chocolate in the nose. Roasted malt, chocolate, light cocoa and vanilla with notes of marshmallow and mild touch of alcohol...and everything well balanced. Soft chocolate and vanilla in the finish. A way better than all Wasatch beers Ive rated before.
This basically tasted like marshmellow, with a bit of vanilla from the graham cracker. Enjoyable definitely a desert beer though

Tap @Taphouse, Cph. Pours deep opaque black with a small, creamy, beige head. Aroma has sweet chocolate, hazelnuts, roasted, vanilla. Low carbonation, fine light dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has good milky chocolate, walnuts, hazelnuts, marshmallows. Solid, lingering malty bitterness.

22oz bottle. Very dark brown color, near-black color. Thin light brown head, some loose bits of lace. Awesome big graham cracker flavor, very evident. Marshmallow, chocolate. Perfect graham cracker flavor... Ive had about 3 other smores stouts, all were imperial... This one at 6.5% is impressively flavorful, doesnt seem light or thin and and just as much smores taste. Medium to bigger body. Smooth kind of creamy lighter carbonation. Nice chewiness to it. Light slickness. Moderate sweet taste, moderate bitter too. Not too sweet. Awesome smores stout.
Draught at Taphouse. Black with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, caramel, vanilla and chocolate.

Aroma and taste is roasted malty, some burnt notes, chocolate, vanilla, marshmallow sweetness. Nice!
Tap. Color dark brown with small brown head. Aroma roasted, malt, chocolate. Taste sweet, roasted, chocolate, vanilla.

24th June 2014Tasting at Bruces pad. Thanks to Bruce! Opaque dark brown beer, small pale cream coloured head. Palate is smooth and semi dry. Light fine carbonation. Creamy dark malts, not heavy. Whisper of malt roast. Good dark chocolate, if slightly powdery tasting. Trace of dark fruits. Light dry finish. Tasty and easy going stout.

Bottle thanks to Bruce. It pours near black with a decent tan head. The nose is sweet, chocolate, marshmallow, fluff, earth, doughnut, candy and fudge. The taste is bitter-sweet, toasty, rich roast, cocoa, mild acidity, vanilla, dark chocolate and a touch spice with a dry finish. Medium body and fine, prickly carbonation. Good depth and nice drinkablity. Tasty.

Bottle shared in London - big thanks to Bruce. Pours rich brown with a creamy tan head. Rich chocolate in the nose, some burnt toast, burnt cereal, medium sweet flavor with background dry smoke, more toasted cereal, earth, milk chocolate, dark dried berries. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Moderately sweet on the finish with some powdery chocolate, earthy bitterness, toast, some crunchy burnt cereal. Tasty enough.

Bottle. Pours a near-black color with a moderate tan head on there. Nose is roasty with a little bit of bread to it, but little else in there. Taste is light and roasty, with a bit of toasting and bread to it. OK, but not particularly remarkable stout for me.

660ml bottle (shared by FatPhil, thanks). Pitch black color. Small size, bubbly brown head, stays. Massive sweetness, chocolate, waffles, cocoa, pancakes in aroma. Molten chocolate ice-cream, some stale coffee as well in taste. This is liquid chocolate ice-cream. You can pour it on your morning pancakes or waffles and eat it. Im not a sugar-tooth, but I also dont hate sweets, but this "beer" gives me heart attack. Thats how sweet it is. But in a way I like it. Confused.

660ml bottle (ALEhouse, Riga) (6:4:5+:3+:12=3.0)
Sweetsweet aroma, chocolatey initially, but becoming more like sweet cocoa powder later. Almost pancakes with chocolate syrup and a dob of butter. Pretty naff taste, in particular for a US porter. Just cheap supermarket chocolate ice cream. Palate full,smooth, perhaps even slick, head small but persistent anda nice tan colour. Finish does have some nice hops to it, so that cant save it. Not a bad beer, but for the US a bad porter. Later I do get the roasted marshmallowey aspects. But that sweetness is insane.

Chocolate taste, I dont really taste the graham cracker or marshmallow, maybe I got a bad bottle. Certainly not as sweet as I was expecting, I will try another bottle to see if this was just a bad one. Was disappointed.

Got in a trade with swingracex. 22 ounce bottle into snifter, bottled on 11/23/2013. Pours pitch black color with a 2 finger dense tan head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a light amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of milk chocolate, cocoa, roast, graham cracker, dark bread, light coffee, vanilla, light cream, herbal, and roasted earthiness. Nice and pleasant aromas with well balanced dark/roasted malt, graham cracker, and spice notes; with solid strength. Taste of milk chocolate, cocoa, roast, graham cracker, light coffee, dark bread, vanilla, light cream, herbal, and roasted earthiness. Minimal bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of milk chocolate, cocoa, roast, graham cracker, dark bread, light coffee, vanilla, and roasted earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Very nice balance and robustness of dark/roasted malt, graham cracker, and spice flavors; with zero cloying sweetness after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a moderately creamy, smooth, and slightly chalky mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is a very good spiced stout. All around well balanced dark/roast malt, graham cracker, and spice flavors; and very smooth to sip on. A nicely enjoyable offering.

bomber shared amongst many. poured a dark almost opaque brown with tan head. the initial aroma is vanilla and coffee with hints of chocolate and of course plenty of roasted malts. the flavor was more of the same...a touch thin in the body but overall very good. more vanilla and chocolate on the tongue. pretty solid start to finish.

Draft. A black beer with a dark brown head. The aroma has notes of chocolate, marshmellow, caramel, roasted malt, and candy sugar. The flavor is sweet with notes of chocolate, marshmellow, ashes, roasted malt, and bread, leading to a dry finish.
22oz bottle. One of my favorite beers. Dark full of gram cracker, chocolate, and a hint of marshmallow. Alcohol content is just right.

Draught at Brews Almighty, Everett, 7.3% ABVBlack color. Aroma of artificial vanilla chocolate. The mouthfeel is quite smooth, and dry; the chocolate flavor is moderate, but dominating; the vanilla (marshmallow) is very artificial, candyish. Correct bitterness.Chaotic.

Bottled. Black coloured. Dense brown head. Aroma. Roast, milk chocolate, sweetness, vanilla. Flavour, sweetness, roast marshmellow, milk chocolate, light coffee, vanilla. Medium bodied. Ends light roasted bitter.

from weak memories, 
very nice stout cause of unique flavor of chocolate cake, notes of cocoa, milky but not as lactic as milk/sweet stouts. Color was close to black, tan brown top, taste was medium+ sweet but not too much, this brew was not so much about roasted malt and deep hopping, no huge dryness, silky, soft, thick texture. Flavor of this brew makes serious sympathy.

Keg at The Commons Ale House, Santa Monica, 16/04/14.
Black with a moderate tan covering that clears to edgework.
Nose is light roast, milk chocolate, dark berry fruit.
Taste carries sweet licks, light roast, nutty pangs, Ribena berry, milk chocolate.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Ok stout.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
650ml bottle @ Maunula beer tasting. Thanks Mikko!


Black/brown stuff with soon vanishing small head. Aroma of milk chocolate. Taste follows aroma - lot of chocolate. Little bit watery, could be better with 1-2% more ABV. Easy.
toast, roasty, coffee, floral, resin, black, cloudy, frothy, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, lively,
Shared bottle, poured darker Black with a mocha head, a ton of sugar soaked marshmallows, toffee, caramel, milk chocolate, bit dry in the finish. Bit to sweet

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Almost black with a small beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, roasted malt, heavy milk chocolate and cocoa. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet and moderate bitter finish. 240414
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are rich chocolate, cocoa, malt, vanilla and hops. Nice.

Bottle, 6.5%. Very dark brown with medium dark beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, milk chocolate and caramel. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, milk chocolate, sweet, caramel, cocoa and medium bitter.

650 ml bottle shared with calm_dreamer. black color, with a very thin brown head. Aromas of chocolate and brown sugar. Taste was very sweet. Chocolate, cocoa, candied things, some caramel, and maybe vanilla. Sweet aftertaste, pretty long. Medium to full body with low carbonation.
Full black body, flat. Medium density. Smells like cocoa, brown sugar, chocolate. Taste of tiramisu, sugar candy, some marshmallows. Medium aftertaste.

Shared bottle at local tasting. Pours nearly black with a tiny white head. Strong chocolate aroma, overwhelming. Taste is better than expected, more light roasty malty notes, with a very good chocolaty feel to it, lingering moderate sweet, nice.

Very dark brown. Beige head. Aroma of chocolate spread, vanilla, chocolate spread, marshmallows and chocolate spread. Similar taste and aftertaste. Well balanced with bitterness. Not too sweet and surprisingly drinkable. Rather one-dimensional.

Shared bottle at local tasting. Black colour, tan head. Strong and lovely aroma of milk chocolate, vanilla, cookies and marshmallows. The flavour is not as sweet as I feared, but the chocolate and vanilla notes are there. Moderate hops in the finish.

Flaske på hytta til Sigmund april-14: flott skum og en overveldende duft av smørbart sjokoladepålegg, vanilje og litt kaffe. Herlig balansert smak, sjokoladesødmen tar ikke overhånd. Lett å dele med gode venner, trenger slett ikke et leirbål for å nyte denne. Lekkerbisken.

Bomber, huge thanks to jmgreenuk! Pitch black beer with a nice beige head. Chocolate and vanilla aroma, nuts, cream, caramel, toffee, fruity notes. Vanilla flavor, chocolate, caramel, creamy, hazelnuts, licorice. Pretty sweet but still drinkable.
Clean, chocolately flavors predominate, with sweeter notes adding to the overall profile.

Big notes of Bosco upfront on the nose, marshmallow, pine. Deep black appearance, light tan head. The flavor is roasty, graham, bitter chocolate, pine. The finish is pine, roast. Medium in body. Nicely done. I think it might have benefit from a little more body, and strength, but still good.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Neimans place. Thanks Neiman. Black with a light brown head. Great aroma full of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee and some vanilla. Sweetish flavor with lots of chocolate, a bit of vanilla and a more roasty finish with a bit of coffee and bitterness. Medium-bodied, rounded mouthfeel. A really good hearty stout.

The aroma and look of this beer saves this beer. A deep, pitch black stout, big frothy mocha head- just how youd like a stout to look. Pretty thick body, carbonation is nice. When I poured this beer I got really excited because it smells ridiculous! Chocolate, vanilla, marshmallow just pours of this thing. Unfortunately the flavor doesnt match. Grainy malts, faint cocoa, a little smoke, vanilla. This would have been a higher rating, but then this thing goes straight metallic on the finish. No bueno. Worth trying, maybe I got a bad bottle.

Dark brown pour some white head. Aroma of exactly smores. Chocolate probably mostly. Milk tang and wheat in the background. Tastes true to smell more into the burnt marshmallow. Watery acidic mid palate some residuals. Given more body and less char this one couldve been a contender. A pleasant enough pretender though.

22oz bottle.
Received in trade.. Not a huge stout fan, but this was better than a lot of them I have had.

Bottle poured into a Belgian snifter. Pours black with brown hues and a finger of tan head. Aromas of smores, caramel, marshmallows, graham cracker, chocolate. Tasting notes of dark chocolate, bitter roast, smoke comes out as it warms. Smells better than it tastes but good overall. Medium body with a dry finish.
Incredible aroma with a thick head. Smells of chocolate, smoke and graham crackers highlight the pour and full flavored taste finishes with a milkshake like texture.

660ml Flasche. Ins Glas ergießt sich ein sehr sehr dunkelbraunes Bier mit geringer aber schönen bräunnlichen Schaumkrone. Geruch intensiv schokoladig, super Geruch!!! Geschmack angehnehm röstmalzig, sehr angenehm schokoladig, Kekse, Kaffe. Weltklasse!!

Milk chocolate, Graham cracker, vanilla, roast. Pours a dark bla k with a mocha colored head. Nice medium body with a touch of bitterness and more of the aroma coming through in the flavor long lasting extract flavor
UPDATED: FEB 2, 2014 Dark body with a thin brown head. There?s a fair amount of marshmallows in the aroma and taste. Thin texture. A bit too sweet for me.

Thin on the tongue. Very nice flavor toasted marshmallow. Aroma also. Thin lasting head. Enjoyable but could be done better I think but good concept. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(Another bottle from my friend, Ken) The nose is rich - vanilla, chocolate, and toasted malts. Pours an opaque black with a robust, but short lived tan head which produces minimal lacing. The taste follows the aroma and is slightly sweet overall. Vanilla, chocolate, toasted malts with hints of gram crackers. Robust flavor. Medium-full body and medium carbonation. Round mouthfeel. Overall, this is an extremely tasty and well crafted stout. Nice job, High Water!

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2014 A great stout. Pours a beautiful black with a thick brown head. Smells like vanilla, cinnamon and caramel. Taste is like s’mores. Lots and lots of vanilla in the taste, maybe almost too much. Very sweet, like a vanilla milk shake. Tastes quite a bit like the Rogue Bacon Pretzel Peanut Butter beer. Had on tap at Billcos. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Black with a small tan head. Malty aroma of caramel, toffee, brown sugar and chocolate. Sweet marshmallow and milk chocolate flavour.

On tap at Steins Beer Garden in Mountain View. Black with slight lacing. Aroma: Smores! Taste: Smores! Wow; roasty, smoke, chocolate, graham crackers, marshmallows. Sweet, with a moderately bitter finish. Full body.

Sampled in a bottle and on tap at Pudleys. A really cool brew. Its a campfire and marchmallows shoved in a bottle. Pours jet black with some carbonation. Really quality made and great cold weather brew.

65cl bottle @Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo. Pours very dark with nice creamy tan head. Some head retention, some lacing. Sweet aromas, milk chocolate ones. Medium body, silky texture, soft carbonation. Taste is very sweet, chocolate, some roasty notes. Sweet aftertaste. Really enjoyable.

Light retention and weak lacing, surprisingly, for a stout. Smells of graham crackers right up front. Followed by marshmallow. Tastes of chocolate first, followed by the marshmallow. And ends with graham cracker in the aftertaste. Great stout. A style I don't normally drink. :)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
65 cl bottle @ home. Pours black with a tan head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are vanilla, cocoa, and roasted malt  with a slightly bitter finish.
Bottle @ Vinoble Dalumvej, Odense. Pours black with a creamy head. Nutella, biscuit, vague roast, chocolate and nuts. Smooth and soft.

Botella de pinta en el Lúpulo Feroz. 
Nada más abrir la botella aroma a puro chocolate. Sabor y aroma chocolateado, endulzado. Buena espuma, aguantó casi hasta el final.

650ml bottle. Darkest brown colour with average, creamy, fully lasting, moderately lacing, tan head. Sweet-ish, chocolately, dark malty aroma with disgusting artificial hints of hundreds and thousands (Liebesperlen), marshmallows and the like. Taste is artificially sweet, Liebesperlen, marshmallows. Reminds me of the artificial chocolately character of Rogues Chocolate Stout but way more awful. Maybe alluring to a New Worlds tongue, but not for me.

Bottle. The aroma is straight caramel with a little smoke but not much. Across the palate you get some more fake sugary notes. It kinda reminds me of crappy frosting. Weird. I think its interesting but the flavors is more for sometime when you are craving that fake sugary sweetness which is almost never for me. Highlights are the unique taste and aroma, lowlights are I, apparently, hate the marshmallows and beer combo.

A strong aroma of honey and butter toast makes me think of midnight snacking. A mostly smooth palate makes the flavors spread out and this becomes even more complex and flavorful. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

small beige head that disappears quickly. coffee coloured. aroma of vanilla, chocolate, sweet, some butter. taste like aroma. rather thin mouthfeel, medium carbonation. pairs really well with oysters :)  bottle 75 cl

On draft at Rogue SF. Pours black with a brown head. Chocolate, vanilla, caramel, marshmallow. Wow this is liquid dessert. Very tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours pitch black with light tan head. Notes of coffee, chocolate, vanilla and biscuit. Flavor is sweet - too sweet for me; a bit like milk chocolate. A little thin for a stout. Lively carbonation. Pretty good, but not a favorite for me.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @ Home. Pours pitch black with a brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, wood, light smoke, sweet milk chocolate. Flavor is very sweet with malts, caramel, little smoke, milk chocolate, caramel. Medium body, soft carbonation, sweet finish. 301113

Bottle @ unibaren. Pitch black, small tan head, some lacing. Aroma, sweet chocolate, roasted notes, i get the Graham crackers, very sweet. Taste, malty, roasted notes, chocolate milk, spices (peppery, cinnamon), . Sweet chocolate, dry liquorice aftertaste. Dry mouth feel. Maybe a bit too much carbonation.

Bottle shared with Abijen, judyvv, Joes and Erwin van Moll @ Van Moll Brewpub. Opaque black color, small light brown head. Aroma is heavy milk chocolate, mocha, some sweetness. Taste is malts, lots of chocolate, mocha, sweet but also a bit bitter in the finish. A lot of flavor, especially since its only 6.5% ABV. Medium body, smooth carbonation.

Pours a dark brown beer with a good tan creamy head. Smells nesquick, white chocolate and vanilla. Tastes chocolate, coffee and milk with a bitter finish. Average carbo, medium body and a dry texture.

Bottle from a recent trade. Really sweet aroma reminds me of the marshmallows and Nutella is a great descriptor. Flavor is a little roasty woody and earthy. Finish is a little sweet. Very interesting stout.
Bottle. Pours deep brown colored with a small off white head. Heavy Nutella aroma with notes of nuts and grain. Flavor is sweet and malty with notes of chocolate and caramel. Dry finish. Tasty..

Pour on tap at GABF, dark brownish black pour with tan head, aroma brought notes of big roast, smoke, slight earth, hints of vanilla, slight chocolate, dark fruits in there go into a bit of sweet graham like notes. Taste is a mix of smoke, roast, hints of dark bitter chocolate, into coffee, nice sweet caramel, graham cracker notes, finishing fairly bitter.
Bottle @ scary newspaper tasting. Aroma is huge milky chocolate, some roast and mocca. Flavour is the same. Lrab.

Night black body with luscious, chocolate creamy top. Delicious aromas of dark chocolate liquor and toasty marshmallow emanate from the glass. Touches of coffee and nuts make it all the more entrancing. Lovely chocolate liquor body with some oatiness and waves of smooth, comfortable roast barley. Well balanced, packed with flavor. Outstanding!

Bottle @ Deans pale lager tasting, courtesy of jmgreenuk. Pours a pitch black beer with light beige head on top. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, vanilla and big roast. Flavor has a lot of chocolate and some lactose influences. Quite a watery moutfheel, making it very easy drinkable, which is a good thing cuz this is delicious.

Utterly delicious beer that stands as a desert in its own. Chocolate (a bit dark), graham cracker and marshmallow. Low to no hops and some of the malt comes through. Seems like their is some milk or oatmeal in there.

Bottle from De Molen. Poured a deep mahogany with a thin broken tan head. The aroma is big milk chocolate and roasted malt. The flavour is strong bitter with a medium bodied chocolate liqourice palate.

Bottle shared thanks to Jmgreenuk. Pours near black with a ring beige head. Aroma of massive milk chocolate and fudge. Flavour is over moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with sort carbonation. By no means complex, but real tasty
Bottle thanks to jmgreenuk. Pours dark brown with a frothy Brown head. Aroma is lots of chocolate and a little bit of coffee. Moderate sweet. Light bitter. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

66cl bottle shared @ THT November 2013
Thin tan head. Clear black pour. Lots of chocolate. Lovely and smooth.

Bottle from Bevmo in Vacaville. Wow!! It takes like s'mores. Aroma of marshmallows and chocolate. I didn't believe the hype, but it tastes exactly like a s'more, chocolate, marshmallow and graham cracker. Sweet!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

pours a jet black with a medium size light brown head and very good lacing.

smell is of milk chocolate, a few nuts, a touch of vanilla, and malt.

taste is creamy, milk chocolate, some graham cracker, a touch of vanilla, and malt. ends smooth and creamy. overall reminds me of a smore over a campfire.

Pours black, minimal tan head.

Smell wheaty, light vanilla and smores cracker. Rice cake.

Taste grahm cracker and honey, marshmellow.

Light body easy drinking.

Very nice

Pours nearly black with a big puffy dark beige head. Aromas of sweet cream/cream soda, vanilla, graham cracker, milk chocolate, roasted malt. Intensely sweet smelling, reminiscent of cookies and cream ice cream. Taste is (thankfully) not nearly as sweet as it smells. Charred marshmallow, milk chocolate, a bit of coffee, and cream soda. Slight roasty bitterness. Medium bodied. Pretty high carbonation produces a mouthfeel that is a little too fizzy but otherwise smooth. Overall this is quite a well executed novelty beer. Worth trying.

Tasted on tap @ Ale House. Looks awesomely black with a bold brown head. Not much smell. Super thick & hardy taste. Similar consistency to an oatmeal stout but more robust. Can definitely taste the chocolate & for some reason the graham cracker flavor comes out. Good malty feel with a well blended alcohol element to round it out. 22 fl oz bottle. Pours hazy dark brown with a small tan to brown head. Aroma is roasted malty and chocolate. Dark roasted malty and dense vanilla. Roasted dark malty. Dense chocolate. Dark malty and lingering vanilla finish.

Sampled on 5/26/2012. This stout pours a dark black color from the tap. Small to medium sized tan foamy head. The aroma is chocolate, coffee, marshmallows, graham crackers and sweet. (Yup it smells like a smore). A medium bodied stout. The malts are chocolate, coffee and sweet. The hops are earthy. Nice carbonation. Its a nice stout, but the graham cracker and marshmallows make it a smore in a bottle with 7.3% alcohol. Nuff said. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly sweet.

Campfire Stout, tap at PP OB. Black body with ruby edges, and a small beige head, quickly fading to a ring. Flavor has some sweet graham cracker toastiness, some lightly sweet chocolate, then follows through to a burnt ashy dry bitter finish, bitterness peaking at a 5. The aroma ws much more dessert-like and smores-ish. Sweet buttery graham cracker and chocolate dominate, light roast behind. Low prickly carbonation with a light to med body. Not bad, but but a little disappointed. I like Joe Shorts version better. 8-3-7-3-13--3.4
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: From the second you pour it into the glass it has the graham cracker aroma, it is one of the most unique Stouts I have had.  Worth a try if you like Smores... and really who doesnt like em?

Wow, they pulled it off. This really does smell like a smore with toasted marshmallow and milk chocolate aroma.  Black with a healthy tan head. Tastes like a Hersheys kiss and I can definitely pick up the graham cracker.  Finishes with a heavily roasted bitter malt.

On tap at Tap 25. It pours a very dark brown with a brown head. The aroma is amazingly exactly like the description. Tons of graham cracker maltiness with some sweet, non-descript sugariness that recalls marshmallows. Hints of coffee and chocolate as well. Props for nailing the aroma! The flavor unfortunately falls a bit short. On first sip, I get a lot of tartness on the palate. Not berry like or astringent, just a bit puckering... There is definitely some some smoke and chocolate, but the tartness overpowers in the end. It finishes really dry and roasted. Weird, considering the sweetness of the aroma. The body is full, so I dont expect any wild yeast here. Overall, this is not my favorite High Water beer, but I love what Steve is doing. This one is just OK in my book.
Tap at Taps restaurant in Petaluma. Fun beer! Huge marshmallow, graham cracker, and vanilla on nose and taste.

Black pour with small tan head. Nose is totally a campfire, chocolate, bready malts, sweetness and a hint of smoke. Creamy body. Chocolate and sweetness throughout. A solid stout. A little gimmicky and too sweet if im honest.

Bottle. Pours with a black body and a huge, creamy tan head. Good retention and lace. Appears a bit over carbbed. Aromas are big, powerful roast, dusty cocoa nibs, marshmallow, vanilla, light smoke. A very pungently earthy/chocolatey aroma. Grainy, dry nutty, very light hints of styrofoam. Flavors are dry, bitter, a bit nutty, bready grainy. Oddly dry and lightly acidic. Vanilla, cocoa nibs, earthy, coffee, dry roast. Some marshmallow like character. Some graham cracker like maltiness. Not really working as it is very dry with a slight acidic edge that detracts. Very lively bubbles, a bit thin, dry medium smoke.

This is really nice...the description is spot-on.  VERY reminiscent of Denver Brewings Graham Cracker Porter (a GABF Bronze 2011)...DBC doesnt bottle so if you want to know what its like try this.  Big sweet marshmallow and graham on the nose.   Taste is the same...sweet upfront but dry with a bitter very dark roasted coffee and dark chocolate finish.  Body could be a little fuller, but Im splitting hairs at this point...Stout treatment is nice on this...mouthfeel is better than DBCs Graham...this is also much more bitter on the end.  Very, very nice.

>>>editing after this has warmed up...mouthfeel in particular has fallen apart and taste has backed off.  Keep it cold and youll be happy..still smells great.

Super dark brown pour, brown head.  Aroma of graham, toasted marshmallow(burned edges included!), fudge and light hops.  Flavor is sweet, smores, light bitter finish and a slight metallic note at the end.  Drink it now.

Draft. Black beer with a tan head. Marshmallow and light roast aroma. Marshmallow and roast flavor. Medium bodied. Sweet marshmallow and roast lingers with light chooclate. Add in some graham crackers and you have smores.

Bottle from Healthy Spirits. Pours dark brown with a thick tan head and a chocolate mousse aroma. There is a hearty chocolate and marshmallow flavor. I dont know what they put in this beer, but it tastes like real marshmallows. Interesting and tasty.

Bomber from The Davis Beer Shoppe. Pours very dark brown/black with a 4 finger darkish tan creamy/foamy head that does some convoluted lacing. Aroma is chocolate and .... wait for it ... graham flour. Strange! Maybe also a hint of treacle. Med + body. Flavor is very graham flour with chocolate (maybe coffee too) and some sweetness that might as well be marshmallow. Interesting. The graham aspect dominates. But chocolate persists into the finish.

Pours deep brown with an exceptional dark tan head. Full nose of graham crackers and chocolate. The flavor has a smooth marshmallow in addition to the influences in the nose, and surprisingly doesnt go to sticky or cloying. Medium full mouthfeel and of course, a fair amount of sweetness.
